Package com.passwordmanager

Class PasswordEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.passwordmanager.PasswordEntry
  • public class PasswordEntry
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a password entry containing a name, password, and metadata. This class encapsulates password entry data and provides controlled access to password information.
    Since:
    2025-06-03
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jose Mondragon

      • PasswordEntry

        public PasswordEntry​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     boolean hasSpecialCharacters)
        Constructs a new PasswordEntry with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - the name or identifier for this password entry
        password - the generated password
        hasSpecialCharacters - indicates if special characters were used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name or password is null or empty

      • hasSpecialCharacters

        public boolean hasSpecialCharacters()
        Indicates whether this password was generated with special characters.
        Returns:
        true if special characters were used, false otherwise

      • getFormattedTimestamp

        Returns the password length.

      • toFileFormat

        public java.lang.String toFileFormat()
        Converts this password entry to a formatted string suitable for file storage. Format: "Name: [name] | Password: [password] | Created: [timestamp] | Special Chars: [yes/no]"
        Returns:
        formatted string representation of this entry

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of this password entry. Note: For security reasons, the password is masked in this representation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation with masked password

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares this password entry with another object for equality. Two password entries are considered equal if they have the same name and password.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - the object to compare with
        Returns:
        true if the objects are equal, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code for this password entry.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        hash code based on name and password
